name: The Hexblade (AKA Pamlock)
overview: Polearm Master, Great Weapon Master, Darkness+Devil's Sight (or Shadow of Moil) to hit stuff HARD

name: The Ranged Fighter
overview: Crossbow Xpert, Sharpshooter, lots of hard hitting ranged attacks

name: The Bear Totem Barb Tank
overview: Be hard to kill and try to lock enemies down while doing so

name: The Monk Ranger (Monger)
overview: Take advantage of Hunter's Mark by making lots of Monk attacks

name: The Assasserer
overview: With auto-crits from surprise, how much burst damage can we do with lots of multiclassing?

name: The Sorlock
overview: Darkness+Devil's Sight +Eldritch Blast +Spiritual Weapon = lots of ranged damage with relative safety

name: The Bladesinger
overview: Shadow Blade + Elven Accuracy = good damage + all those Wizard spells

name: The Fightarian
overview: Breaking down who's the better PAM+GWM user, the Fighter or the Barbarian? (Answer: Both)

name: The Killer Bard
overview: XBX, SS, Hand Xbow Mostly Bard that does high ranged damage and… still gets to Bard :)

name: Spell Damage Analysis
overview: trying to figure out which spells were best for each class for sustained DPR

name: The Death Cleric
overview: Trying to do damage to multiple enemies every round via Toll the Dead, Spirit Guardians, etc.

name: The Paladin Tank (Tankadin)
overview: Be hard to kill and protect your allies as best you can as a Pally Tank

name: The PHB Beast Master
overview: A viable Beast Master using the Player's Handbook version!?

name: Brainy and the Beast
overview: First "Two Build" vid for friends - a Druid and a Wizard built to control and burn down in AOE
role: Duo Build: Sustained DPR and Control

name: The Support Lore Bard
overview: A Bard focused on healing first, seduction and insults second

name: The Yin Yang Team
overview: A "Team Up" build of two Hexblades. Darkness, Devil's Sight, Double Haste. It's nasty good.

name: The Swashbuckler
overview: Run up, attack, step away, enemy takes Booming Blade Damage and gets hit with pet attacks

name: Tasha's Breakdown (Pt 1)
overview: Breaking down all the changes we got from Tasha's Cauldron of Everything

name: Bladesinger 2.0
overview: Post Tasha's, update to 1.0 with new features, spells, taking advantage of Animate Objects, etc.

name: Beast Master 2.0
overview: Post Tasha's, *vastly* improved update using the new Pet Options, primarily

name: Tasha's Breakdown (Pt 2)
overview: Breaking down all the changes we got from Tasha's Cauldron of Everything

name: The Armorer
overview: My first Artificer, built for survivability/utility/support (Guardian model) - makes a *great* tank.

name: The Grappler Monk
overview: A Wisdom SAD Monk for grappling and damage… works better on paper than in game :(

name: Sorcerer with the Magic Touch
overview: My first "Artificial Restrictions for the sake of concept" build - you can only do damage with touch spells

name: Mounted Battle Smith
overview: Everyone said a mounted creature dual-wielding lances would be amazing…

name: Battery and the Blender
overview: A "Team Up" build of an Order Cleric and a Rogue, my first time trying to get sneak attack 2x per round

name: The Lockadin Bard
overview: A Hexblade/Bard built for Burst Damage/Smites, played in campaign for over a year. Works fantastically.

name: The Pokémon Trainer
overview: The concept: what if we could *only* do damage via our summoned creatures/pets?

name: The Anti-Mage
overview: A character built with a focus on taking out and not being affected by magic-users (needs Counterspell ;) )

name: The Needler
overview: How effective could we be if we could only use Darts for our weapon? (Hint: Super Effective)

name: Kaladin Stormblessed
overview: My first (and last?) attempt to recreate a character from Fiction (Stormlight Archive) in D&D

name: The Abjuration Wizard Tank
overview: A Wizard Tank? Turns out, yeah, works *reeeeeally* well

name: The Blood Hunter Mutant
overview: My first "unofficial material" build using Critical Role's Blood Hunter class

name: The Spore Beast
overview: Beast Barbarian Attacks with the Spore Druid damage bonus = damage, tankiness *and* OOC support

name: The Rogue Tank
overview: Can a Rogue be built to tank? I think so, as long as you multiclass them :)

name: Necromancer & Oathbreaker
overview: A "Team Up" build mostly designed to show how broken Animate Dead can be :)

name: The Thornlock
overview: Concept: What if we could *only* do damage by returning damage when we get hit? So fun.

name: The Rune Knight
overview: My first collab with Treantmonk! We both build the "best" Rune Knight we can and compare notes

name: The Mercy Monk
overview: Taking the "new" subclass for a test drive: knock enemies prone and pummel/poison them

name: The Moon Druid
overview: How good is a mostly Moon Druid? Can Bears Grapple and drag enemies? Can I have a pet bear too?

name: The Death Knight
overview: A dark, bursty, plate-wearing, big weapon swinging wrecking ball

name: The Undead Supportlock
overview: A fear-based, lock 'em down Lockadin

name: Burst Spell Damage Analysis
overview: trying to figure out which spells were best for each class for burst damage

name: The Ultimate Blaster
overview: FIREBALLS!!!

name: The Flame Thrower
overview: SCORCHING RAYS!!!

name: The Wolf and the Coyote
overview: A "Team Up" build trying with a big barb and a little rogue synergizing for lots of damage

name: The Cheese Grater
overview: Sorlock, Spike Growth, Push and pull and push and pull and grind them to dust

name: The Ultimate Crit Fisher
overview: Big Weapon, crit lots, smite when you do

name: Starry Twilight Healer
overview: Wanna be a full-time healer? Twilight Clerics make it EZ mode :)

name: The Whip-poorwill
overview: I discuss a whip-focused Rogue while Randall Hampton draws it live while I reveal the build

name: The Knight in Shining Armor
overview: Ride my faithful steed into battle to defend the righteous

name: The Bladesinger Nova
overview: Maximizing nova damage with Shadow Blade

name: The Melee Fey Wanderer
overview: So many Fey Spirits! Summoning, hitting, controling, and being tricksy

name: The Critlander
overview: A Sorcadin built for massive burst on a paralyzed target

name: The Combat Medic
overview: A healer who uses no magic/spells for their healing

name: The Infiltrator
overview: Building around the Infiltrator Model of the Armorer Artificer for stealth and damage

name: The Catch-22
overview: Put enemies in a position where, if they move they take damage, but if they don't move they take damage

name: The Monk Tank
overview: A Monk build to taunt and survive

name: The Ultimate Skill Monkey
overview: Getting proficiency in every skill asap (with plenty of expertise to boot)

name: The Master of the Storm
overview: The ultimate Lightning-Based Character

name: The Swarmkeeper Slingshot
overview: Using a Sling to Throw Pebbles and push enemies through spike growth

name: The Control Freak
overview: The Ultimate Wizard Controller - locking down all the enemies, all the time

name: The Oath of Vengeance
overview: A Vengeance Pally build for lots of attacks and lots of smites

name: The Dhampir Tank
overview: A Vampire Tank, healing themselves with their bite

name: The Ascendant Dragon Monk
overview: Trying to make the most of the "new" Dragon Monk subclass - doing multi-target damage

name: How to Train Your Dragon
overview: Using the "new" Drakewarden Ranger, focusing on getting a powerful pet dragon

name: The Eldritch Blademaster
overview: Trying to make the highest damage-dealing two-weapon user possible. Super Gishy. Super fun.

name: The Martyr
overview: A healer who can *only* heal by sacrificing their own health via the Life Transference spell

name: The Swashbuckler Nova
overview: A Swashbuckler built to hit and run and hit again

name: The Artillerist Artificer
overview: My first Artillerist - built to do damage to mutliple enemies with spells, flame throwers, and a humonculus

name: The Bard-Barian
overview: Combining Bard and Barb for some fantastic burst damage that ROCKS!

name: The Battle Smith Tank
overview: Can you build a character who's *pet* is actually tanking? I think so!

name: The Psi Knife
overview: Combining the Soul Knife Rogue with the Psi Warrior Fighter for an "ultimate" Psionics Martial

name: The Nuclear Wizard
overview: A build for Wil Wheaton - burst damage that doesn't depend on you rolling well to be effective

name: The Street Fighter
overview: A (mostly) non-monk brawler/pugilist - they grapple, they spit in your eye and wrestle you to the ground

name: The Ashardalon's Strider
overview: Building around the spell - lots of speed, damage to multiple enemies, tons of fun

name: The Fate Weaver
overview: Combining lots of ways of reducing enemy saving throws so we can land a stunning strike (and other things)

name: The Arcane Spellbow
overview: Trying to make the best use out of the Arcane Archer we possibly can

name: The Bladesinger Tank
overview: A… Bladesinger Tank ;) (pssst… high on both concept and mechanical awesomeness!)

name: The Dive Bomber
overview: Grapple an enemy, fly up as high as you can, drop them for big damage

name: The Swords Bard
overview: A bursty, gishy, mostly swords bard bard

name: Nature's Wrath
overview: A high damage Nature Cleric - spirit guardians, thorn whip, melting everything

name: The Mount and Blade (pt 1)
overview: Team up build - one character is a Centaur doing damage…

name: The Mount and Blade (pt 2)
overview: ...the other, a tank who rides on their back

name: The Battle Smith Controller
overview: Throwing Hammers at multiple enemies to push them into Web and generally cause havoc

name: The Gloom Stalker
overview: The quintissential Gloomstalker + Assassin for big round 1 burst damage from the dark

name: The Whisperer
overview: Mostly Whispers Bard, part support, part utility, all nova damage.

name: The Stars Druid
overview: Pushing enemies into our spells for big damage with a healthy heaping of support options

name: The Frost Mage
overview: Sustained Damage and Control, exclusively with the power of cold/frost

name: The Clockwork Sorcerer Tank
overview: The Clockwork Soul is versatile and can be *really* hard to kill!

name: The Shield Master
overview: A control and defensive focused "shield only" build. Bashing, shoving, etc.

name: The Shepherd Druid
overview: Ok fine! How Broken is the Conjure Animals spell? A: Very, very broken

name: The Battlefield Commander
overview: A Non-Magic using, Drill-Sergeant-like Martial Support character

name: The Bladesinger Monk
overview: Combining my two favorite classes in game for a super mobile and agile striker with great defense

name: The Shadow Sorcerer
overview: A build focused on lowering enemy saving throws so we can hit them with big burst damage spells

name: The Holy Warrior
overview: Super self-righteous smiting with a big weapon and consistent advantage and great defense!? Oof.

name: The Bard Tank
overview: A Bard who can stack their AC about as high as any character in game *and* taunt? Plus… be a Bard!

name: The Shaman
overview: Challenge: Make a Barbarian who can play support. Challenge accepted!

name: The Thunderball
overview: A Secret-Agent inspired build, meant to infiltrate, blow things up, and get out

name: The Shadow Blade
overview: Trying to get the most we possibly can out of the Shadow Blade spell by always being in Dim Light

name: The Moon Guardian
overview: A mostly-Druid tank who becomes a bear, taunts, and is very, very tough

name: The Master of Shadows
overview: How I wish I would've built my first 5e character - a high damage Shadow Monk/Warlock

name: The Burst of Light
overview: An AOE blaster that's almost full cleric. A nuclear bomb of righteousness.

name: The Berserker Lurker
overview: A Strength-based rogue built to get sneak attack twice per round

name: The Poison Dart Frog
overview: A Grung who focuses on doing as much poison damage as possible with their skin and blow gun

name: The Invisible Helper
overview: How good a support could you be if you focused on remaining invisible throughout combat? Pretty good!

name: The Gunk
overview: Monk + Guns. Turns out that 3 attacks per round with a musket is pretty dang good.

name: The Praying Mantis
overview: A Thri-kreen who grapples and then slices and dices

name: The Mind Flayer
overview: A tentacle-focused character built for control and burst damage

name: The Divine Protector
overview: A Cleric Tank. Holy cow are they hard to kill.

name: The Oathbreaker
overview: An Evil (?) Pally that ends up doing it all: sustained damage, survivability, and support in spades

name: The Psyclaw
overview: Part Wolverine, part Psylocke, all claws and psychic blades

name: The Eldritch Whisperer
overview: Q: What's the maximum number of Eldritch Blasts we could get in one round? A: A lot

name: The Werewolf
overview: A Werewolf inspired Bloodhunter that frenzies, pounces, and slashes

name: The Wildfire Cleaver
overview: A Druid Gish, dealing damage to 2 enemies per round if they're standing next to each other

name: The Bardic Brawler
overview: A grappling-focused bard who wrecks multiple enemies every round with Cloud of Daggers

name: The Quickened Blade
overview: A hasted rogue gets lots of attacks and sneak attack twice per round

name: The Bear Totem Guardian
overview: A "Better" Bear Totem Barb Tank - are they really as tanky as everyone thinks?

name: The Way of the Open Spores
overview: Gross name, super effective Monk/Druid combo that pushes through *lots* of spike growth

name: The Time Wizard
overview: A Chronurgist who maximizes Animate Objects damage with double concentration

name: The One-Hit Wonder
overview: Q: How hard can we hit if we only get *one* attack? A: Harder than you might think :)

name: The Sniper
overview: A long range musket-user who snipes your entire squad

name: The HexBladeSinger
overview: Combining my (until then) two most popular vids - The Hexblade and the Bladesinger, into one ranged gish

name: The Four Elements Avatar
overview: The best Four Elements Monk I can build

name: The Cantrip Blaster
overview: Let's focus on only doing damage with cantrips so we can save those spell slots for more important things

name: Learning Pathfinder
overview: Teaching PF2e from a D&D Vet perspective

name: The Psionic Protector
overview: Can we be an effective Tank from range instead of melee? Yup!

name: The War Priest
overview: When you want to support, sure, but also smash stuff with your hammer really, really hard

name: The Catapult
overview: Could we launch an enemy 100 feet into the air? Yes. And it's hilarious. And decent damage!

name: The Flamesinger
overview: Bladesinger 3.0? 2.0+ Burst Damage, with the help of hurting ourselves with Fire to hurt our enemy more

name: The Alchemist
overview: A hybrid support/sustained damage dealer that gets double bless and lots of utility

name: The Tanklock
overview: A Warlock Tank, focused on healing themselves and protecting their allies

name: The Tasmanian Devil
overview: A strength-based monk that makes *so* many attacks - with claw and fist

name: The Swords Bard Cleaver
overview: A Bard focused on doing damage to two enemies standing next to each other

name: The Assassin's Creed
overview: Quadruple damage burst makes things dead… as long as you get surprise!

name: The Invisible Hypnotist
overview: A support/controller who stays invisible for every fight

name: The Cosmic Controller
overview: A Monk/Cleric who grapples, pummels, and supports all at the same time

name: Nature's Guardian
overview: A Pally Tank who protects like mad and taunts like a Kender

name: The Supernova Moon
overview: Moon Druid goes BOOM! (Boomkin?)

name: Song of Ice and Artifice
overview: A control-focused damage build that locks their targets in place with multiple snares

name: Mind Over Matter
overview: An Intelligence-based Fighter?

name: The Flurry of Darkness
overview: 10 Attacks in a single opening round of combat = big burst

name: The Knight of Knaves
overview: A Piratey Paladin Rogue combo that hits hard and says "Arrrrrr"

name: The Three Bears
overview: Daddy Bear, Mama Bear, and Baby Bear all in a single build? Don't forget Goldilocks!

name: The Arcane Trickster
overview: The Roguiest Rogue - taking no fewer than 4 levels in any other class but still doing good damage?

name: The Clockwork Controller
overview: Can a Sorcerer be a *better* controller even than a full Wizard?

name: The Barbarian From Hell!
overview: Barbarian + Warlock = a great character for doing damage when they hit *and* when they get hit

name: The Arcane Hand Monk
overview: Creating a Build for the Dungeon Dudes' Drakkenheim Monk Subclass, Way of the Arcane Hand (so good!)

name: The Moon Singer
overview: A Bladesinging Bear has no right to be this powerful.

name: The Giant Barbarian
overview: Taking the "New" hardest hitting Barbarian through it's paces

name: The Shadow Blade Monk
overview: An armor wearing Monk who makes 3 attacks every round with my favorite weapon in game: Shadow Blade

name: The Order Cleric
overview: A build focused on doing damage themselves but also giving mutliple allies reaction attacks

name: Hexblade 2.0
overview: A dual wielding Hexblade that attacks with Charisma for each weapon

name: The Stealth Bomber
overview: An Wizard Assassin?

name: The Hand of the Open Sea
overview: Trying to build the best "One D&D" Playtest Monk I can (with a healthy heaping of Druid)

name: The Ultimate Healer
overview: What's the most healing we can possibly do in combat with a single character?

name: The Over-Reactor
overview: Can we build a character who gets a reaction attack almost every single round?

name: The Phantom Menace
overview: A Rogue "Cleaver," doing damage to two enemies standing next to each other with… darts

name: Drop Dead Fred
overview: Summon a menagerie of pets and feign death so they can all act on their own!

name: The Flurry of Throws
overview: A Monk/Ranger Beekeper Cheesegrater :)

name: The Warm Hug
overview: Make yourself immune to fire damage, cast Heat Metal on yourself, and grapple the enemy…

name: The Echo Knight
overview: Finaly doing a build where we are *mostly* Echo Knight. Is it truly the best Fighter subclass? OP?

name: The Smiting Bladesinger
overview: Isn't a Bladesinger/Paladin combo too MAD? Not if you go Tortle :)

name: The Sun Soul Monk
overview: Can we make the worst subclass of the worst class in 5e good?

name: The Starry Knight
overview: An AOE damage dealer "support" character that I played for a year in a campaign. So good.

name: The Hexbow
overview: The highest damage dealing ranged weapon user in 5e is… a caster. /eyeroll
